"Get the O2 Wallet App
- Send money to friends as easily as a text
- Securely store any payment card
- Instantly browse over 120 online shops
Link my O2 Wallet now
First you will need the latest version of the O2 Wallet to do this. Please download O2 Wallet from the BlackBerry App World Store
To auto-link both O2 Train Travel and O2 Wallet. Close this app ad go to your O2 Wallet and open Train Travel from the home screen. The link will happen automatically - Nice and simple"
Please enter a valid card name
Please enter a valid card number
Please enter a valid expiry month
Please enter a valid expiry year
Invalid Issue Number - Issue number must not exceed 12
" Are you sure you want to quit? "
Sorry, the app got disconnected. Please try again later.
You must give permission to access the network when asked. Please restart the application to do this.
"Sorry, the server isn't available. Please try again later."
"We're very sorry but something has gone wrong so you won't be able to continue with this request."
Sorry, it is not possible to do this using SMS messages. Would you like to try connecting over the Internet?
"We're sorry, that transaction might not have completed. Please refresh 'My tickets' to see if your purchase has been successful."
An update is available for this application. Select Ok to download the new version, or Cancel to continue using the application.
This application requires an upgrade. Select Ok to download a new version, or Quit to stop using the application.
Thank-you for sending your phone number. Please quit the application - we will send you an SMS shortly with a link to the upgraded app.
"To complete the upgrade, please enter this mobile phone's number"
The application will quit, and you will be sent an SMS with a link to the new version.
"Failed to connect over the Internet. Would you like to try again using SMS (each message costing the usual SMS price)? Please note: SMS offers a reduced set of fares, without any timetables."

"Your ticket has been paid for.
You can find it under the 'My tickets' menu whenever you need it."
"Please select the journey's origin and destination stations."
The origin and destination stations are the same
Please select at least one passenger to travel
Sorry, you can only select up to ### passengers
"Sorry, you can't select more Railcards than passengers"
No tickets of this type are available for this train.
Please enter all date(s) and time(s) for the journey.
Please enter a valid date and time.
Please ensure the outbound journey is before the return.
There are no train times available.
Sorry, the outbound fare you selected is no longer available. Please select another.

"Sorry, the return fare you selected is not available at that date and time.
Please either select alternative fare(s), or go Back and change your travel dates."

"Sorry, it is not possible to select one return ticket that spans those dates and times.
Please select two single fares to make the same journey."
- set Return date to see full price
Please enter all dates and times for the journey.
No tickets here. If you feel there should be, try to refresh!
"'My tickets' has been refreshed and you have no additional tickets"
One or more tickets were received but could not be saved. Please refresh My Tickets, and contact customer services if the problem happens again.
"One or more tickets were purchased and received but could not be saved. Please refresh 'My tickets', and contact customer services to resolve this issue."
No fares found for this journey.

No fares were sent over SMS for this journey. Either there are no fares for the journey, or they require a timetable to select. If you resubmit the request, the application will try to use the Internet to retrieve a full timetable.
Are you sure you want to delete this ticket?
This ticket will be sent to your phone.

"You need to pick your ticket up from the ticket machine at your departure station (or at any other station with a ticket machine). You'll need a bank card. You might be asked for the card you bought the ticket with, but any bank card will work."

"Sorry! The departure station for this journey has no facilities for you to pick up your ticket. Please collect from an alternative station. You'll need a bank card to collect your tickets. You might be asked for the card you bought the ticket with, but any bank card will work."
Your email and password were accepted. This account will now be associated with all future purchases.
Your email and/or password was successfully updated.
Sorry, your account details were incorrect.
Your registered account email has been changed.
Your login details have changed. Please log in with your new details.
Are you sure you want to log out?
Are you sure you want to skip login? Future purchases will no longer be associated with your account.
Note: once entered, your login will be used for all future purchases.
"If you've changed your account password on our website, you can update it here."
"Please update your login details to complete your purchase, or select 'Skip Login' to purchase without logging in."
Your latest live station search will appear here!
These options represent different flexibility and price trade-offs for the same journey. You can check both before you buy.
"This journey can only be purchased using one single ticket to go out, and a separate single ticket to come back. "
Adjust this date and time to see a list of trains on which this ticket may be used
The ticket selected is valid on the following trains
Note: Go back to check validity at other times/dates.
You have selected a mobile mTicket, this option is currently not available on this version of the app. Please check for updates or select a pickup (orange) ticket instead.
Outbound ticket is only valid on the specified train(s)
Return ticket is only valid on this one train
You have reservations on this outbound journey, please check details below
You have reservations on this return journey, please check below
The following restrictions apply to the ticket you will pick up

"You need to pick your ticket up from the ticket machine at your departure station (or at any other station with a ticket machine). You'll need a bank card. You might be asked for the card you bought the ticket with, but any bank card will work."
You must bring with you ANY payment card in your name.
Payment card used to purchase ticket
The Masabi UK mobile rail ticketing application.

"Terms and conditions apply to the use of this application and any ticket purchases made using the application.
Go to http://o2.co.uk/money/o2trainterms to read the full terms and conditions.
By purchasing a ticket using this application you agree to accept these terms and conditions."

"O2 Train Travel is an app for searching train times and buying tickets.
Once you've linked your O2 Wallet to O2 Train Travel and have found your ticket, all you have to do is type in your Pay Password, and the security number (CVV) for the card you want to use. Or you can always manually type in your debit or credit card details
We'll always send you an mTicket (if it's available for your train journey).
Once we've sent you the mTicket or paper ticket collection code, it will stay on your phone for 30 days after the expiry date of your ticket.
If you’re connected via wifi it’s free to search for train times and buy tickets.
If you’re using 3G your provider might charge you. As a general rule, the amount of internet you’ll need to buy each ticket will cost you less than 1p. But make sure you understand how your provider charges for using 3G before you use the app.
You don’t need to be connected to a mobile network or wifi to look at any tickets you’ve bought.
If you are having any trouble give us a call on 10202 (free for O2 customers) or 0844 70 10202 (charges apply) and we'll help"

"Train journeys that have a paper ticket symbol must be collected from a station ticket machine before you leave.
If we can’t send you a mTicket, we’ll send you a collection reference code. You can find this under ’My Tickets’ in the main menu. You’ll need to type this in to a self-service ticket machine at the station to get your tickets. You’ll also need to have a bank card in your name with you, to put into the machine. But you won’t be charged again. It doesn’t have to be the card that you used to purchase the ticket, but it has to be in your name.
Don’t forget, the collection reference itself isn’t a ticket.
The collection code will stay on your phone for 30 days after the expiry date of your ticket."

"mTickets are available for some journeys; these will show a barcode symbol and will be sent to your phone.
Once we’ve sent you the mTicket, you’ll find it under ’My tickets’ in the main menu. It’ll stay on there for 30 days after the expiry date of your ticket.
At the station, you’ll either need to scan it at the gate, or show it to someone from the train operator to scan.
A mTicket is just like a paper ticket. So when you use it to travel, you might be asked to show it at any time.
You don’t need to be connected to a mobile network or wifi to look at any tickets you’ve bought.
We are unable to provide a receipt for your journey where an mTicket is purchased via the O2 Train Travel Mobile app."

"O2 Train Travel
Welcome to O2 Train Travel together with redspottedhanky.com. The following terms between you and Telefónica Financial Services UK Limited (“O2”) apply to your use of O2 Train Travel app. If you do not agree to these terms, do not use the app.
1. O2 Train Travel gives you access to purchase train tickets from and enter into an agreement with Atos IT Services UK Limited (“redspottedhanky.com”). redspottedhanky.com are responsible for fulfilling your train ticket purchase. You agree to their terms and privacy & data protection policy. Go to http://o2.co.uk/money/o2trainterms
2. By using O2 Train Travel, you agree to your data being passed to O2. This data includes type of mobile phone, software version, browser type and version, train ticket searches and purchases, other app usage, menu options and buttons selected. O2 will use this data for product insight and service improvements only. O2’s Privacy Policy applies, Go to http://www.o2.co.uk/termsandconditions/privacy-policy
3. Despite what it says in O2’s privacy policy and redspottedhanky.com’s privacy & data protection policy, redspottedhanky.com will not create an account for you and O2 and redspottedhanky.com will not use your data to market to you. If O2 and/or redspottedhanky.com turn on this function in the future, they will tell you and you can opt out of marketing if you wish.
4. If you choose to link O2 Train Travel to your O2 Wallet, the O2 Wallet terms also apply – go to http://www.o2.co.uk/termsandconditions/finance-and-insurance/o2-money-wallet
5. O2 may send you in-app notifications. You can turn these off by changing your phone settings.
Telefónica Financial Services UK Limited, registered in England and Wales at registered office 260 Bath Road, Slough, Berkshire, SL1 4DX, company number 7584114 "

"Type in your Security Code. This is the last 3 numbers on the signature strip of your chosen card or the 3 digit code we texted you if you don't have the physical O2 Money Card."
Have you got an O2 Wallet?

We can't link your O2 Wallet to O2 Train Travel right now, please try it later. You can still buy your ticket using the app but you'll have to enter your card details manually."

"• Send money to friends as easily as a text
• Securely store any payment card
• Instantly browse over 120 online shops
"
Link Train Travel to your O2 Wallet

"First you'll need the latest version of the O2 Wallet App to do this.
There are two ways you can link them:
Autolink - Close this App and go to your O2 Wallet and open Train Travel from the home screen. The link will happen automatically - Nice and simple
Link Manually - You'll need your My O2 username and password and O2 Money Account password."
Link to O2 Train Travel to make buying tickets much faster.
